english: land; continent; dry land; to land

etymology.interpretation: Left 阝 is the place/terrain radical, cueing meanings related to land or settlements. Right-side 坴 supplied the sound lù and evokes raised earth; in simplification it was replaced by 击 for ease while the semantic cue on the left was retained.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 陸 by replacing the phonetic 坴 with the simpler, high-frequency 击 (坴 → 击) to reduce strokes while keeping the left semantic 阝.

examples.chinese: 船靠岸后，乘客踏上陆地(船靠岸後，乘客踏上陸地)。
examples.pinyin: Chuán kào àn hòu, chéngkè tà shàng lùdì.
examples.english: After the ship docked, passengers stepped onto land.

examples.chinese: 飞机遇到大雾，改在附近机场着陆(飛機遇到大霧，改在附近機場著陸)。
examples.pinyin: Fēijī yùdào dàwù, gǎi zài fùjìn jīchǎng zhuólù.
examples.english: The plane encountered heavy fog and diverted to land at a nearby airport.

examples.chinese: 非洲是世界上第二大的大陆(非洲是世界上第二大的大陸)。
examples.pinyin: Fēizhōu shì shìjiè shàng dì-èr dà de dàlù.
examples.english: Africa is the second-largest continent in the world.
